data.title: 2019 Summer Scholars Program applications due
data.description: EVMS Pediatrics is accepting applications through Thursday, Jan 31, 2019 from college seniors and first-year medical or graduate students for a paid summer research internships.
data.full-description: EVMS Pediatrics is accepting applications through Thursday, Jan. 31, 2019, from college seniors and first-year medical or graduate students for paid, summer research internships through the 2019 Summer Scholars Program. Students will work on pre-selected research projects under the mentorship of EVMS faculty members. Projects will involve clinical, pre-clinical/laboratory, public health, behavioral research, educational research and global health. Students selected for the program will receive a stipend for these full-time positions, which run from May 20 to Aug. 1, 2019. For details, email Laurie McManama.

data.title: 9th Annual Insights into Autism: Autism Spectrum Disorders Across the Lifespan: Transitions, Technology, and Treatments
data.description: EVMS Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences and Children’s Hospital of The King’s Daughters (CHKD) is hosting the 9th Annual Insights into Autism conference entitled Autism Spectrum Disorders Across the Lifespan: Transitions, Technology, and Treatments. The conference will be held February 1, 2018, from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. in the CHKD Brickhouse Auditorium in Norfolk, Virginia. Continental breakfast and registration is from 7:30-8 a.m. Physicians and other professionals are invited to attend.   Please contact David Elkins at the EVMS Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) program at 757.446.5176 or email autism@evms.edu for questions or further information. Thank you for your interest in autism services and we hope that you will be able to attend.
